results.title: Behind the airline
results.creator_credit: Movietonenews, Qantas Empire Airways, H.G. Guinness and Frank Coffey
results.brief_description: December 1953 was the 50th anniversary of heavier than air flight. This film compares the early flights by the Wright Brothers in America and W.E. Hart in Australia, with the highly complex organization of a modern international airline in Australia. The film illustrates the many activities of airline personnel, all of whom play their part in keeping aircraft in the air. Commentary by Harry Dearth, photography by Syd Wood.

results.title: Behaviour therapy: an introduction (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This film describes and explains three models for learning: operant; classical and observational. Demonstrates the application of each model in therapeutic settings involving behaviour therapists and clients. No other credits available.

results.title: Behaviour patterns at one year
results.creator_credit: Yale Clinic of Child Development and Arnold Gesell
results.brief_description: Portrays the behaviour patterns of a normal infant fifty-two weeks of age. The baby’s manipulation and other reactions to one, two, three, and ten cubes are interpreted and discussed by the narrator. Continues with the study of other test situations involving a cup and a spoon, cup and cubes, pellet, pellet and bottle, ball, ring and string, paper and crayon, a performance box, and a form board.

results.title: Behaviour patterns and survival
results.brief_description: Depicts the behaviour of the Slaty Backed Gull. Types of chick behaviour, innate and learned are shown by response to parent’s voice. Originally in Japanese - dubbed into English. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Behaviour modification: teaching language to psychotic children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Appleton-Century-Crofts, Robert Aller and O-Ivor Lovaas
results.brief_description: Shows typical speech patterns of autistic and schizophrenic children, and discusses correction of these before learning begins. Demonstrates instruction methods in imitation of sounds, labelling of objects, discrimination between alternatives, recall of experiences, and development of some spontaneity.

results.title: Beginnings of vertebrate life
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and William Kay
results.brief_description: Reveals complex processes by which a one-celled egg, becomes a many-celled, highly organized individual. Shows by means of time-lapse photography and animation the embryonic development of a small fresh water fish, Oryzias latipes, illustrating early processes of fertilization, cell division and formation of the blastula.

results.title: Beginnings of conscience
results.brief_description: A driver obeys traffic signs even when there is no one in sight because he has a conscience, instilled since childhood by his daily life at home, school, and work. The socialization process is analysed in terms of the life of an “average” boy. Shows influence of parental approval or disapproval, peer acceptance or rejection, and forms of discipline in various social situations. In a nutshell, this film implores the “educational aspect of punishment.” It explains that without socialisation, and without the sanctions used to achieve it, there would be no basis for moral order in human society.

results.title: Beginnings - Inspiration - the Role of the Writer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Writers on Writing”.
This series is based on a growing archive of video material of conversations between contemporary writers discussing their work. The material has been re-edited to form a resource for students and teachers of English, and each of the six twenty-minute videos focuses on different aspects and stages of the writing process. Each video is accompanied by a resource booklet. In this video, writers talk about how they began to write, what their inspiration is and their perception of the writer’s role.
